alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Leslie; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 2:39AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Harlan, southwestern Letcher, central Leslie and southeastern Perry Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 239 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hoskinston, or near Hyden, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cinda, Causey, Smilax and Napier around 245 AM EDT. Cutshin, Big Fork, Daley and Frew around 250 AM EDT. Yeaddiss, Big Rock and Big Laurel around 255 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Leatherwood, Arthur, Viper, Slemp, Gilley, Daisy, Cornettsville and Delphia. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway near mile marker 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
